STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 17, 2021
Dustin Hogue
South Bluff Teaching Family Home
1005 Silver Creek Rd.
Marquette, MI 49855
RE: License #: CI520304229
South Bluff Teaching Family Home
1005 Silver Creek Rd.
Marquette, MI 49855
Dear Mr. Hogue:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
March 8, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 For any repeat violations, why the prior CAP failed to achieve compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Claudia Triestram at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 200
121 Franklin Street SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date an
initial treatment plan for each resident within 30 calendar days
of admission.
Two youth files were reviewed. One of two youth files did not have an initial
treatment plan completed.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(f) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations from either of the following entities:
(i) Directly from the Michigan state police or the
equivalent state law enforcement agency, Canadian province, or
other country where the person usually resides or has resided in
the previous 5 years.
(ii) From an entity accessing either Michigan state police
records or equivalent state, Canadian provincial, or other
country law enforcement agency where the person usually
resides or has resided in the previous 5 years.
Three new employee files were reviewed. One of three new employee files had the
criminal background check completed after hire.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
1

equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
Three new employee files were reviewed. One of three new employee files had the
central registry check completed after hire.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
Three new employee files were reviewed. Two of three new employees did not have
an evaluation completed within the first 180 days of hire.
Three employee files were reviewed for employees that had been employed for over
a year. One of three employees that required an annual evaluation did not have the
evaluation completed.
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
2

Three new employee files were reviewed. Three of three new employees had their
Tuberculosis screening done after hire.
Three employee files were reviewed for employees that had been employed for over
a year. Two of three employees did not have the annual Tuberculosis screening
completed.
R 400.4115 First aid; CPR.
A person certified within the preceding 36 months in first aid and
within the preceding 24 months in age-appropriate
cardiopulmonary resuscitation by the American Red Cross, the
American Heart Association, or an equivalent organization or
institution approved by the department shall be on duty at all
times when 1 or more children are present.
Three new employee files were reviewed. One of three new employees is not trained
in CPR or First Aid.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose
function is covered by these rules has participated in a minimum
of 50 clock hours of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training
annually thereafter related to the employee’s job function. At
least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the first year shall be
orientation provided prior to the assumption of duties.
Three employee files were reviewed for employees that had been employed for over
a year. Two of three employees lacked the required 25 hours of annual training.
R 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
(1) An initial health screening shall be completed for each
resident within 24 hours of admission to a facility.
Two youth files were reviewed. Two of two youth files did not have the initial health
screening that is required to be completed within 24 hours of admission.
R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's case record:
3

(c) A brief description of the resident's preparation for
placement and general physical and emotional state at the time
of admission.
Two youth files were reviewed. One of two youth files lacked the description of the
youth’s preparation for placement and general physical and emotional state at the
time of admission.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Intake documentation: the chief administrator said the intake documents are
filled out by the referring worker however many of the areas on the document
are requirements of the facility to acquire. It was recommended that they have
their social service worker review and make additions to the intake face sheet
to ensure all areas are completed and information is gathered about the youth.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
4

The facility has submitted seven acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. Reviews of all corrective action plans have
been done throughout this period under review and the facility has either completed
or is in compliance with all corrective action plans at this time.
A tour of the facility was conducted during the inspection. The facility is clean and in
good condition. The menus were viewed for the month and appeared appropriate.
The youth bedrooms are well furnished and clean. The bathrooms were clean and in
good condition. The facility keeps the medications double locked as well as all
cleaning supplies. There were no concerns noted during the tour of the facility.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on their regular license.
_____________________________________March 17, 2021
Stephanie Meeuwenberg Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 17, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
